headline: Easy Smoked Sausage Skillet
description: This one-skillet sausage recipe for dinner is easy to prepare and made with bell pepper, onion, broccoli, and rice, topped with mozzarella cheese.

video.description: Dinner's on the table in no time with this one-skillet sausage and veggie dish served over rice.
video.name: Easy Smoked Sausage Skillet

name: Easy Smoked Sausage Skillet
recipeIngredient: 1 (14 ounce) package Hillshire Farm¬Æ Smoked Sausage, diagonally cut into 1/4-inch slices
1 large red bell pepper, sliced thin

recipeInstructions.text: Heat olive oil and crushed garlic in a large skillet. Stir in smoked sausage slices and cook until browned on all sides.
Add pepper, onion, broccoli, chicken broth, and tomato sauce. Simmer until vegetables are tender and the liquid is absorbed, about 10 minutes.
In the meantime, cook rice according to package instructions.
Stir cooked rice into the skillet, sprinkle with cheese, and serve.

review.reviewBody: I really enjoyed this and look forward to making it again soon üòä. The change I made with ingredients was adding more cheese. Next time I plan to use less rice also, and I will definitely try this one without the rice.
I loved this recipe. The only changes I made were to the garlic and sausage. I used Cajun spiced andouille smoked sausage and minced garlic. I will definitely make this again.

Was good for a weeknight meal. I par boiled potatoes in chicken broth that I drained, then added the potatoes to the sausage mixture to saut√©, used the broth to cook the regular rice, the excess broth was added to the sausage and fresh vegetable mixture for the simmer time. Didn't have tomato sauce but used up some fresh tomatoes, worked out well with the broth. Had pepper jack vs mozzarella, hubs really liked it. Was a good meal and easy prep after a long day at work.
Bland, added a little sriracha, which helped a bit.

I added yellow pepper as well. And cooked brown rice in rice cooker as it takes brown rice to cook longer and I wanted the whole grain rice for better nutrition. This left sauce to put on the rice in the pan.
I made it but I didn't put the red peppers in it. It turned out perfect. Tastes great!
Loved it just a few tweeks

I did half smoked sausage and 3 spicy sausage links (casings off and cut up) and added salt and pepper to the sausage while cooking. I used 3 tsp minced garlic (from jar) and 1 full can of tomato sauce. To add flavor I added 1 tsp garlic powder, 1 tsp oregano, a sprinkle of smoked paprika, and a little salt and pepper to the sauce/vegetables. I put the lid on top until broccoli was steamed. I cooked the rice separate and served the dish over rice instead of mixing them together. It has great flavor.
Love this recipe, have been making it for years. For any of you that want a little extra kick, a few drops of siracha sauce does wonders!

I made it according to the recipe except my broccoli was fresh and I cooked regular rice in chicken broth. It was somewhat bland but a generous salt and peppering really helped. Maybe some onion powder and other spices could've made it into something special. In the end it was quick, easy, and tasted pretty good.

We love this recipe as a starting point. To make this simple & fast, I use SALSA instead of tomato sauce, peppers and onions. Gives it a bit more flavor and eliminates the need for chopping! Otherwise, we follow as directed.
Made it when it first was advertised and loved it then and now. Easy one skillet recepie. Love it.
Very tasty, I did use a different sausage brand but otherwise the meal was made as written. I've made this twice and will definitely be making it again.

My family enjoyed this. I always read reviews first so I did double the tomato sauce and added some crushed red pepper. I decided to cook the rice with the rest of the ingredients so added rice and extra liquid to the pan. If you use minute rice, put broccoli in right away. I used basmati so had to cook 18 minutes and added fresh broccoli last 8 minutes. This gave the rice good flavor too. Great 1 pot meal!
So good!
A fairly quick weeknight dinner recipe. I doubled the tomato sauce, used vegetable broth instead of chicken, and Tofurky for the sausage. Ended up with a tasty veggie version of this dish
Not really. Was good
Easy to make but it was missing some flavor. It was edible but needs more flavor.
It was a little bland for my group so instead of plain tomatoe sauce, I used ¬Ω jar of spaghetti sauce. Even the picky eater went back for seconds. I will definitely make it again.
Delicious and easy.
Very BLAND! I suggest using some seasoning . I added more Tomato sauce and some andouille sausage . But still a bland dish, this one needs some major improvising .
I was out of Broccolii,so I used corn and added a little jalepeno..

This is a delicious quick one-skillet meal. So flavorful and easy. My family loved it and it'll be on our menu twice a month. I made one change and that was rice. I don't use instant rice so had none on-hand. Regular rice worked fine. Such a good recipe!

Cooked in a 5 qt pot instead of skillet. Used all fresh vegetables, my red bell pepper was soft, so I used a green and a yellow. Made brown rice and I am glad I did since I covered to simmer all the other ingredients and it came out super soupy, so the rice would have been mushy if it weren‚Äôt brown. Needed some spice since it was rather plain other than the smoked sausage. Still a pretty tasty dish. I did not read any reviews until after I was done, otherwise I would have followed some others and added more spice.
it was awesome. I added some crushed chilies and extra mozzarella .
Really delicious recipe and easy to make!
Very good
It was easy to make and everyone loved it!
very easy and tasty . recommend to drain grease from sausage before adding everything else . it‚Äòll get soupy at the bottom .

This is a remarkably good meal. Delicious. We are in Coronavirus lockdown mode, so I keep a variety of frozen vegetables. I used a package of three pepper and onion blend, and a package of broccoli. I used a full 14 oz. can of tomato sauce, and I cooked 3/4 cup of brown rice to add. Like everyone else, I cook with what‚Äôs in the pantry. I had no mozzarella cheese, so we used grated Parmesan. This was a low effort but tasty meal.
Very GOOD

Quick, easy, and tasty. I may change a few things ; I did add ground pepper. More veggies is my style ( like Cabbage ), but I did use half the sausage. I will make this again 'cause it's filling, and there's plenty leftovers for me ,myself, and I. I may share...or not!
Added Creole Seasoning, salt and pepper. Kept it juicy and served over rice instead of mixing in the rice.
Used fresh sausage & omitted the peppers. Yes will make again.
The skillet recipe with HILLSHIRE FARM SMOKED SAUSAGE WAS EASY ,GREAT TASTING,HEALTHY AND FUN TO MAKE

I really liked this recipe but I made some tweaks that made it more flavorful. Instead of tomato sauce, I used 1 can of diced tomatoes and then I added some onion powder, chili powder, cayenne, salt, and pepper. I really enjoyed it and I'll definitely make it again.
Delicious, family loved it.
Since I didn't have instant white rice, I used Zatarains cilantro lime rice which gives the dish a very interesting flavor I'm sure, but it turned out well just the same.
Dice the pepper

Very tasty! And Easy! I added some hot pepper flakes and salt. I had a can of diced tomatoes so I did a half a cup of that with juice instead of the tomato sauce. Only made one cup of rice and it was plenty!!! Will make again.
Very easy to make and all of the seasoning comes from the smoked sausage.
Yes I will definitely make it again! My family loved it. I used cheddar cheese because I didn‚Äôt have mozzarella. I think it was delicious!
very delicouse!!!

It turn out ok but the the vegetables and the tomato sauce with the water had to cook a lot longer it was on this wet side, I would probably didn't leave out the water and do the whole can of tomato sauce like other people have said as the water and tomato sauce didn't mix will I had to cook off the water.
I used everything that the recipe called for except I used smoked turkey sausage and potatoes (out of rice). My family really enjoyed it. I will cook it again.

Big hit with the family as a week-day dinner! After reading the reviews, I altered the directions but kept all the ingredients as is. Cooked the rice independently. Then cooked the sausage first, (otherwise the garlic gets too charred). Used a slotted spoon to remove the smoked sausage once it was browned. Added the (fresh) pepper and onions to the oil for 7 minutes, sprinkled kosher salt to taste. Added the (fresh) broccoli and garlic, for an additional 2 minutes. Added the tomato sauce (with salt) and the water to the skillet for 2 minutes, returned the sausage with the cooked rice to the skillet and mixed everything together. Sprinkled with cheese and YUM!! (I think cooking things separately, adding kosher salt to the veggies while they cook and using salted tomato sauce fixes the bland flavor problem)

I substituted two things but other than that everything came out amazing. So instead of putting broccoli I put mixed vegetables and instead of mozzarella cheese I put sharp cheddar. The kids loved it my parents ate it up. This meal was amazing.
Used a bag of frozen stir fry veggies instead. Perfect.

Made a 1/2 order for two exactly as stated by the recipe but added some fresh green beans, califlower, and sharp cheddar. WOW it was amazing with no added spices. 
Had the request to make the other half for tomorrow's lunch. 
Oh, tried a little soy sauce on the last couple of bites.... Heaven.

This came out deliciously. My whole family loved it. I used raw hot sausages instead of Hillshire smoked sausages so it took almost a 1/2 more too cook. I also used regular rice, not the instant. Spending the extra time was worth it.
This was amazing! I make it at least once a month.
Didn‚Äôt have actual garlic, but it was simple and delicious. Will make again

Made as listed but used shredded cheddar cause that‚Äôs all I had. Too much rice, needed more liquids and any spice would have helped. It was filling and we were hungry but won‚Äôt make it like this again.

It was pretty tasty and very easy to prepare. I did forget to add the cheese - oops! The only negative is that it was somewhat greasy. The next time I make this dish, I'm going to cut back on the amount of oil and see if that helps.

Like many reviewers I also found this a little bland. But that‚Äôs ok. I enjoy finding good recipes with ingredients I like and then spicing it up to my taste. And this is definitely a good recipe! It will be fun experimenting.

I love this dish everything about it 
It‚Äôs really simple to make and everybody in the family loves it

I kept double checking the recipe as I made it to make sure I didn‚Äôt miss out on any seasoning. I followed the recipe except I added a teaspoon of Louisiana seasoning. The result: it was still bland! Next time I will cooked the rice in the chicken broth, skip the tomato sauce and use Rotel Diced Tomatoes and Jalape√±os to kick it up!! I will also added Louisiana seasoning to the garlic, sausage, pepper and onion mixture.

This dish was pretty good, but of course I made changes. First, I used Johnsonville roasted garlic turkey sausage because it‚Äôs what I had at home. I used the 15 oz can of contadina Italian and herbs tomato sauce instead of the 1/2 cup of regular sauce and minced garlic instead of crushed. I used a bag of frozen stir fry vegetables (red peppers, yellow peppers and onions) and the baby broccoli florets. I followed the regular instructions, but added pepper, garlic powder, seasoning salt and crushed red peppers for seasoning. I used shredded Colby jack cheese, but don‚Äôt really know how much.
The only thing I changed is I used rotel in place of the tomato sauce. Delicious quick and easy. We loved it!!
I made this last night and my husband love it! It‚Äôs super easy and fast to make.
Actually,my ex fiance made it and it was heavenly!!!!
It was really good. I used Butterball Smoked Turkey Sausage because that's what we had. We also used cauliflower rice to cut down on carbs. I will definitely make it again.
Really good and a quick meal to make on a busy night!
Very good and easy. Cleanup was a breeze!
Not really impressed. Lacked overall flavor and ingredients didn‚Äôt seem to go together flavor wise. Also needed more seasoning, pretty bland if done by the recipe. Probably not going to make again.
Excluded the rice and added about 4 slice of bacon and topped it all with a fried egg. A keto version of this that adds some extra protein
I substituted frozen broccoli for fresh and simmered the garlic for an extra long time on medium to begin. Everything had great flavor. Will make again.
This was great! I added extra chicken broth, spaghetti sauce and ground cayenne pepper for a little kick!

I used less oil and subbed catsup for tom. sauce. I used only 1/2 pound of the smoked sausage- we are watching fats and trying to eat more veges. Last I used shredded Pecorino Romano instead of mozzarella, just because we like it.

This recipe was very good, I would make it again but next time I believe I would put a small jar of mild salsa in it. I like my food to have a little more spice. This recipe was a little to bland, Also if your a first timer to make this, chop up everything first and make your rice then cook the meat last because it does tend to burn easily when your doing other things while the meat is cooking.
I would double it for a family of four. It was easy and tasted good. I‚Äôll make it again.

I had everything except broccoli but made it anyway. I used jalapeno sausage and it turned out great! There is plenty for leftovers the next day. Great to take for lunch to work! I definitely will make again. I might even throw in the broccoli next time! Others have said this recipe was bland. Use jalapeno sausage and that will liven it up!!

I decided to make this tonight and we were definitely not disappointed! I did what another commenter did however, and used all fresh vegetables, doubled the tomato sauce and used a mix of jasmine rice and basmati rice made fresh rather than instant. I didn't layer however, but once I put the cheese on I popped it into the oven for a quick few mins on high broil to really melt the cheese and get a bit of a brown going on. My husband loved this dish, and devoured three bowls before I could finish my one, lol it was absolutely delicious! It does need a little something, he says hot sauce though I don't like hot sauce, but something like that just for that extra little punch of flavour. This is definitely a new favorite, thank you!

I have made this many times, each time I use what I have on hand. Tonight it was Echrich 4-Pepper smoked sausage (quite spicy-hot!), fresh broccoli, diced fresh tomatoes, and red and yellow sweet peppers, sliced. I use 2 Tbsp tomato paste in place of the sauce. I have even put frozen corn in this! This is a no-fail recipe, and lets you make it your own!
I followed the recipe! This dish is quick, easy and delicious! Winner!!
I also used turkey smoked sausage... still delicious!

Delicious!!! . I used a full- size can of tomato sauce (~14 oz) and no water - but mixed the chicken bouillon into the tomato sauce. I did everything else per the recipe, except I didn‚Äôt add the mozzarella. Served it over rice and - yum! Happy hubby, happy tummy! Thank you for a quick & easy DELICIOUS recipe!

I made this using the Hillshire Farm chicken smoked sausage. I cooked parboiled rice to use because I never use instant. I added the garlic after the sausage and veggies were almost done as to not burn it. Added a little black pepper. It was quite good. It was reminiscent of a Cajun dish so I added Louisiana hot sauce when it was served. It was tasty. I would make it again.
My 5 year old loved this, not a common thing. Thanks for the recipe!
my mom will love this she is such a veggies person, I love what veggies you used great combination

Fantastic! Only substitutions: Used a frozen package of Broccoli Normandy (a blend of broccoli florets, cauliflower florets, orange carrots, and yellow carrots) for the broccoli, some fresh spinach leaves, and a cup of tomato sauce instead of the half cup. The spinach leaves were a nice addition if you like spinach. Thank you for this recipe!!
Used Janet Kirby Zesto suggestions from June 6, 2016. I also added tomato paste and Italian stewed tomatoes 1 can each.

As written, this is OK. Here's how I do it to get this to closer to five stars:

INGREDIENTS:
‚Ä¢	1 TB Olive Oil
‚Ä¢	1 TB Butter
‚Ä¢	1 Pound Smoked Sausage, sliced into ¬º‚Äù slices
‚Ä¢	1 Large Red Bell Pepper, ¬º‚Äô diced 
‚Ä¢	1 Medium Yellow Onion, small diced
‚Ä¢	2 Garlic Cloves, Minced
‚Ä¢	¬Ω tsp Onion Powder
‚Ä¢	1 tsp Dried Oregano
‚Ä¢	¬º tsp Crushed Red Pepper Flakes
‚Ä¢	2 Cups Broccoli Florets
‚Ä¢	¬Ω cup Chicken Broth (or water)
‚Ä¢	1 cup Tomato Sauce
‚Ä¢	2 cups Cooked Brown Rice
‚Ä¢	1 cup Sharp Cheddar, Grated
DIRECTIONS:
1)	Add oil and butter to pan and heat over medium-high. Cook the sausage until browned, about 5 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, remove sausage from pan and set aside.
2)	Add the bell pepper and onions and saut√© until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic, onion powder, oregano and red pepper flakes and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
3)	Add the chicken broth and tomato sauce, and simmer for 5 minutes uncovered. Add the broccoli, cover, and continue to simmer for about four minutes, until broccoli is crisp-tender.
4)	Uncover pan, add sausage and cook until liquid is almost completely absorbed. Add cooked rice and cheese and stir to combine and warm through and melt cheese. Season with salt and pepper.
I didn‚Äôt use the cheese at the end but it was a hit with the kids and husband!
Very good followed the recipe

This is one I make every so often because it's so good. I added twice as much tomato sauce and added pepper, basil, and oregano. I actually have tons of wild rice on hand and it's even better with it I believe but white rice is good too. The whole family loves it.
Made exactly has written with exception of adding salt and pepper. It looked really pretty, but we couldn't eatit. Really disappointed.
It was tasty. I had no tomato sauce on hand so used marinara sauce instead. It was tasty. I used regular rice. Only one cup of rice would have been fine.

I followed the recipe exactly. I‚Äôm not a cook I dabble my husband is the chef. I found this recipe to be pretty good except for the fact it was very bland. I think I should of added spices to it while it was simmering. I will try again with seasonings.
So delicious!! Definitely something I'll make again.

My family loved this! But I have to admit I used what I had on hand which was fresh veggies, regular rice, and venison smoked sausage. I thought it might turn out a little bland with no seasonings so I added garlic salt and pepper. But with the venison smoked sausage it had tons of flavor. So while I can't honestly say I made this exact recipe, it was still an absolutely delicious idea! Thanks for sharing!
Excellent!

I really liked this recipe, but I did change a little bit. I added 8 oz. of tomato sauce. And I used a box of beef flavored rice and I added about a quarter cup of dry basmati rice to it and cooked it with chicken broth. I can't add a photo because its all gone now ,but it did look real good.
I was skeptical at first, but this is really good!
So easy, I added my own spices. I recommend hot pepper flakes. My boyfriend LOVES this!
I love this recipe! Are use cooked brown or wild rice instead of instant. But if you don‚Äôt have time, instant rice is the way to go. It‚Äôs quick easy and so very delicious!
Turned out great! I didn‚Äôt use the garlic or the chicken broth but instead used a little more tomato sauce. The family and I loved it!

I used all ingredients but substituted rotel for the mater sauce and added tony chacheres & fresh cracked black pepper, a few dashes of scorned woman and a pinch of chipotle smoked pepper. Doubled the cheese, of course :) and it was great! Will make it again and again.

I always try the original recipe before making changes, but not this time. The recipe looked way too bland! These are the changes I made, and it turned out amazing! My kids really liked it! 1) I used 3-4 cloves garlic and only a couple TBSPs of oil 2) Brown rice cooked in a rice maker ahead of time 3)Fresh Broccoli instead of frozen 4) Better than Bouillon Chicken base mixed with 1/4 cup water 5) Lastly, I added a splash of Liquid smoke and some pepper and a half a can of black beans. No cheese. My 16 and 18 yr olds cleared their plates. :)
